definition: A global control mode in which an agent prioritizes trying novel actions, hypotheses, or strategies over exploiting known high-value options.

positive_examples: For now, try a wide variety of prompts to see what works, even if some fail.
The agent is in exploration mode and deliberately samples from less certain options.
She experimented with several unconventional strategies before settling on one.
negative_examples: He always uses the same proven procedure without deviation.
The system exploits the current best policy and avoids risky alternatives.
She followed the standard operating procedure exactly.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not just curiosity in general; specifically a control regime that biases choices toward novelty or information gain over immediate reward.
